page.title: 11COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: Laindon station has been in existence for much longer than Basildon Station. It was built to serve the original village of Laindon. There is a smaller ticket office but no shop. There is also a parcels office where people can send parcels all over the country by rail. There is a signal box on the platform, constructed of wood in the traditional Essex style. There are three platform, and three lines at Laindon Station. The signal box controls the points that send the train to the correct platform.The Signal Box also controls all the signals both up and down the lines. At each end of the paltform there are some boards with numbers 4 8 and 12 spaced along the track. These baords tell the driver where to stop if he has 4 8 or 12 carriages on his train.
